intro: Spilanthes peregrina, commonly known as the wandering hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, and it typically grows in dry, open habitats. Spilanthes peregrina is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
